title: Initiating Branch
description: Establish foundational authority and secure the project mandate. This is where the project's right to exist is confirmed.

questions.q: Which document officially assigns the Project Manager and provides them with authority?
What is the primary output of the 'Identify Stakeholders' process?

simulation.title: The Power/Interest Trap
simulation.scenario: A high-power stakeholder is ignoring your project and hasn't attended any meetings. What is your first move?
simulation.logic: In my 16 years, I've seen 'Keep Satisfied' stakeholders become project-killers. You must pull them into 'Manage Closely' early. A 1-on-1 aligns their specific interests with project value.

audit.errorText: The project will be completed as fast as possible to make the client happy.
audit.fix: Objectives must be SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound). Happiness is subjective; use a metric like 'Reduce latency by 15% by Q4'.

veteranCase.title: The Invisible Gatekeeper
veteranCase.story: During a massive infrastructure project, we identified all the city council members but forgot the local water board. They held the 'permit' trigger and shut us down 2 weeks before launch because we didn't consult them on specs.
veteranCase.lesson: Identification isn't a list; it's a hunt. Always ask your identified stakeholders: 'Who else should I be talking to?'

flashcards.front: When is the Project Manager officially assigned?
flashcards.back: Always during the development of the Project Charter, before planning begins.

flashcards.front: What are the only two processes in Initiating?
flashcards.back: 1. Develop Project Charter and 2. Identify Stakeholders.
